name: Cluster
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster
description:
Cluster

A configuration object describing how Cloud Bigtable should treat traffic from a particular end user application.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

instance = bigtable.instance("my-instance")
cluster = instance.cluster("my-cluster")

# Update
cluster.nodes = 3
cluster.save

# Delete
cluster.delete

methods.name: path
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#path
methods.description: The unique name of the cluster. Value in the form projects/<project_id>/instances/<instance_id>/clusters/<cluster_id>.

methods.name: state
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#state
methods.description: The current instance state. Possible values are :CREATING, :READY, :STATE_NOT_KNOWN, :RESIZING, :DISABLED.

methods.name: ready?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#ready?
methods.description: The cluster has been successfully created and is ready to serve requests.

methods.name: creating?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#creating?
methods.description: The instance is currently being created, and may be destroyed if the creation process encounters an error.

methods.name: resizing?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#resizing?
methods.description: The cluster is currently being resized, and may revert to its previous node count if the process encounters an error. A cluster is still capable of serving requests while being resized, but may exhibit performance as if its number of allocated nodes is between the starting and requested states.

methods.name: disabled?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#disabled?
methods.description: The cluster has no backing nodes. The data (tables) still exist, but no operations can be performed on the cluster.

methods.name: nodes
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#nodes
methods.description: The number of nodes allocated to this cluster.

methods.name: nodes=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#nodes=
methods.description: The number of nodes allocated to this cluster. More nodes enable higher throughput and more consistent performance.

methods.name: storage_type
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#storage_type
methods.description: The type of storage used by this cluster to serve its parent instance’s tables, unless explicitly overridden. Valid values are :SSD(Flash (SSD) storage should be used), :HDD(Magnetic drive (HDD) storage should be used)

methods.name: save
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
Cluster#save
methods.description:
Update cluster.

Updatable fields are no of nodes.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

instance = bigtable.instance("my-instance")
cluster = instance.cluster("my-cluster")
cluster.nodes = 3
job = cluster.save

job.done? #=> false

# To block until the operation completes.
job.wait_until_done!
job.done? #=> true

if job.error?
  status = job.error
else
  cluster = job.cluster
end

returns.description:
The job representing the long-running, asynchronous processing of
an update cluster operation.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new

instance = bigtable.instance("my-instance")
cluster = instance.cluster("my-cluster")
cluster.delete

returns.description: Returns true if the cluster was deleted.
